intro: Gnidia katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga gnidia, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas. Gnidia katangensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in some local communities.
